page.title: 01How our village grew.
page.content: {Brinsley was mentioned in the original Domesday Book where it was called Brunsley.Charles the Second hid in Brinsley Hall which is now a farm.The houses in Brinsley were built from bricks made at the local brickyard which closed down in 1830. The post office in Brinsley was owned by D.H.Lawrences' Uncle George.In the second world war 225 children were evacuated to the village. The original school in Brinsley had no toilets and no running water.Also they had only one room where classes were taken but they split the room in 1_5 standards. 100 years ago there were no buses or cars to take you places so you had to walk 2 miles to the nearest steam train station.In Brinsley there were no lights until 1908.The first sewage works was built in 1906.
